meanings.sent1: The scientist measured the substance with precision to the milesimo.
meanings.sent2: The recipe called for adding just a milesimo amount of salt.
meanings.sent3: The tiny ant thought it found a milesimo crumb of food, but it was just a speck of dirt.
meanings.sent4: In the vast ocean, each fish seemed like a milesimo part of a grand puzzle.
meanings.sent5: The milesimo mark on the ruler was barely visible without a magnifying glass.

meanings.definition: The ordinal number of one thousand in counting order.
meanings.sent1: She won the race by crossing the finish line at the milesimo position.
meanings.sent2: The library had books shelved up to the milesimo volume.
meanings.sent3: The teacher joked that the student's tardiness was due to waiting for the milesimo bell to ring.
meanings.sent4: The milesimo day of the year felt special, as it marked a new beginning.
meanings.sent5: The milesimo step of the staircase creaked under his weight.
